Reviews.Title: “Rooms were clean but customer service lacked”
Reviews.Author: Kart13
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with family and found it to be not suitable for families because a) Right next to the busy road outside (noisy), b) no room service or food available in the hotel c) breakfast included but very little to offer for vegetarians and parking was not available easily. Other then these factors its a nice place to stay for a night as its economical and clean. One more good thing about it was high speed Wi-Fi :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in the internet is important to you”
Reviews.Author: julietheoracle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, rooms are simply furnished, beds are comfy, but overall we did not think this place gave good value for money. The free internet didn't work most of the time. To access the internet we had to carry our laptop over a courtyard, down a footpath, up a flight of stairs to the breakfast room. After all that, it still didn't work some of the time! This is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Berlin hotel for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: ThatSemanticsGuy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Hotel Am Savignyplatz for 4 nights and were quite happy with the hotel. It is inside an apartment building, so the location has a residential (versus large hotel) feel, and our room, while not large, was comfortable and very clean. The hotel is located close to the Savignyplatz SB stop, making it easy to reach the hotel and to go explore the city. The neighborhood is nice, with a number of good restaurants, and the hotel provides a good cold breakfast each morning, with a selection of meats, cheeses, breads, etc, along with juices, coffee, and tea. From when we first made our reservation to when we departed the service was always prompt and helpful. There are a couple of things to be aware of, though, that could be problematic. First, we didn't find a way to access the hotel, on the first floor (US second floor), using an elevator. This meant having to carry up luggage and a stroller. If you have a lot of luggage, this could be a problem, so check with the hotel first. Second, we did have some noise from the floor above ours. In our case this was someone quite good practicing the piano, but if you are sound sensitive this could make it difficult to sleep. Even though our room faced out onto a major street, we didn't have any problems with street noise, so apparently the insulation around the windows is quite good. Overall, a nice place to stay, especially for the price, and one we would be willing to return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “well spend money for accomondation”
Reviews.Author: kathishark
Reviews.Content: located near a railway station, we had a nice stay at the hotel am Savignyplatz. Rooms were simple but very clean, which seems to be not mandatory in other b&b's i visited during my travels. The quarter around the hotel is a usual Berliner area with lots of small retro/ alterativ/ hippie shows narrow sideways. Though i would not recommend a stay with small children since there's drug trafficing in the area, with is quite common for berlin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: chrissymoore29
Reviews.Content: [--] we had a brill time staying here agree with the previous review without repeating ourselves. difference being we had requested a quiet room and was honoured. the main entrance to the hotel can be a little confusing but it doesnt take long to understand were reception was, up the stairs on first floor. i could not fault the hospitality of the staff. this accomadation is great value for money and is central enough to explore. there is only so many things you can do inside a few days so dont push yourself, ttry not to cram everything in because berlin is big and it is amazing. best city we have been to yet. to sum up the hotel is cheap, clean and comfortable. free tea and coffee as much as you like too. it is not luxurious but it is everything you need to explore the city. we truley enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxonion24
Reviews.Content: Mike and Doreen May 2007 This is a good hotel for the budget conscious traveller, offering clean spacious rooms with hot showers and large comfortable beds. Free tea and coffee avaliable night and day and a good breakfast make for en enjoyable stay. Zimmers 1-8 very good and quiet, while 9-11 in the hotel annex are to be avoided at all cost due to excessive overnight noise from upstairs residents. Reliable and cheap public transport on the doorstep, good and plentiful bars , restaurants and shops make for an ideal location. Staff have limited english but are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: joeyt28
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, about 2 minutes from the Savignyplatz U-Bahn. I had a small single room, but it was very clean. The TV had more channels that I was used to, and amenities like a mint on pillow on arrival and a nice, powerful shower and soap. The bathroom was in good shape, and the wood floor was nice. I'm not sure if the hotel is new or if the rooms were just recently renovated, but it is very up to date and clean. Breakfast is also big, with a lot of nice options. A couple small negatives. The staff only speak a small amount of English, but I got by okay with pointing and facial expressions. They are all very nice. It can be noisy at night because of both street noise and noise from the other rooms ... the rooms are close together and it was definitely possible to hear people coming in late at night. No staff is present from 10 on, so you have a key to open the front door and another key to open the door to the hotel, which is up one floor from the ground level. Overall, I had a very nice stay. Good value and amenities for such a location. Also, I don't think many people know about it yet.

Reviews.Title: “great value at the hotel am savignyplatz”
Reviews.Author: katybarry
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights in hotel am savignyplatz on kantstrasse which is five minutes walk from the kudamm, the main thoroughfare of old west berlin. The streets around the hotel had a number of cosy restaurants and some wonderfully atmospheric old berlin pubs, not to mention interesting bookshops and quirky specialty shops. The hotel is ideal for the budget traveller. It is very reasonably priced, spotlessly clean with spacious rooms and a hearty breakfast that will set a traveller up for the day. The proximity to the S Bahn station at Savignyplatz also allows for speedy travel to other parts of the city. One small quibble is the fact that the walls are thin so noisy guests might be a problem. On the plus side the staff are very friendly and helpful and the coffee is the best I've had anywhere on my travels.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Am Savignyplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Kantstrasse 22, 10623 Berlin, Germany
